intro: Chromolaena stillingiifolia, commonly known as the Hawaiian triffid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, woody stems. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a rough texture. It is known for its rapid growth and invasive tendencies in certain environments. Chromolaena stillingiifolia is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open forests.
